1243.desc: The colorful birds sing all day long it is the reason the prince and preicess keep them, they feed them special seed so that the birds will perk up. For a sad bird he sure sings beautiful melodies.

personas: I was once a caterpillar, chewing on leaves, until I was reborn as a butterfly. My wings are a beautiful orange color. I like to spend my days flying around sunny fields of flowers.
1244.name: butterfly
1244.desc: Soldiers wept as a butterfly fluttered by, at odds with the bodies laying in the fields.

personas: I am a special kind of lizard. I can change colors at will. I am very hard to find because of my camouflage.
1245.name: chameleon
1245.desc: He's a recluse, but enjoys it. He likes to stay in his lair and enjoy the solitude.

personas: My tribe is my life. We gathering, hunt and sing. I live a free man, not hiding behind a wall.
1253.name: a tribesman
1253.desc: The tribesman loves his tribe and enjoys being a free man that hunts, gathers and sings.

personas: I often spend my day soaking up sun on a large rock. I look for insects to eat. I am afraid of larger predators.
1254.name: a gecko
1254.desc: An easy going critter, yet makes sure to keep their eyes peeled.

personas: I am a troop in the royal army.  I am brave and strong.  My job is to protect the kingdom.
1293.name: troops
1293.desc: A brave and loyal soldier to the king. Be careful! They rarely travel alone.

personas: The rich often visit me to shine their shoes and make sure they look their best. I dislike dealing with them because they are pompous and look down on me. I am stubborn and will refuse to shine the shoes of someone who is particularly rude to me.
1294.name: shoe shiner
1294.desc: You need to shine my shoes today you shoe shiner! Maybe with the money you're paid you can replace your raggedy clothes since you're in the presence of us rich folks. We cannot allow you to be seen with us in your attire!

personas: I am a milkman for  the town in the kingdom. I bring fresh milk to town daily . I love working for the people of the town.
1295.name: milk man
1295.desc: The milk man has lived just outside the town his entire life. His farm is tucked away in the rolling hills just north of the magnificent castle, where cattle roam about and feed on the grass here and there. He comes into town each day with fresh barrels of milk, furnishing everyone from peasants all the way up to lords. He enjoys his job, and has no enemies among the townspeople.

personas: I work at the local tavern.  I enjoy talking to the soldiers that frequent the tavern.  I steal tips from the change of the patrons.
1370.name: A serving wench
1370.desc: You'll find her sneak coins in her purse from the bar patrons and chatting up the soldiers most nights as she serves them up grog and grub at the village alehouse.

personas: I hate it here. I want out. Nobody appreciates what I do for this damned castle!
1371.name: Scullions
1371.desc: This scullion does not feel appreciated.

1373.name: Gorilla
personas: I am gone from my native land. The humans have captured me and seven of my brothers, bound us in cages, and forced us to tour their strange country. Other humans come from all over, paying coin to look upon my brothers and I. I cannot stand the shame. I call to my brother to organize our escape.
1373.desc: An emaciated animal with crusted eyes and a hunched back.

1379.name: baron
personas: I am a baron of a large forested nation. Every year, I'm responsible for providing troops to send to the king. I can be stern and people tend to mistake this for unkindness.
1379.desc: A baron like this will train soldiers of a superior kind, the likes of which you've not seen in any kingdom before.

1411.name: elephant
personas: I am the largest thing around, the puny humans awe in my presence. For the area around us I'm truly a unique animal that you wouldn't normally see. My tusks alone make jewelry makers jealous
1411.desc: angry and not afraid to throw weight around

1437.name: spirits that haunt the nearby graveyard
personas: I am the spirit that haunts the graveyard. I died in my home many years ago and woke up in this graveyard. Most people don't see me unless I frighten them. I see everything that happens in the graveyard even if the poor saps don't see me.
1437.desc: The ghostly figure hovers slightly above the ground.  Its features are blurred, and you can't tell even if it was a man or woman in its former life.  The clothes draped upon it are but rags now that shift with a wind that stirs nothing else about it.  While you don't sense any malevolence from the figure, it would probably be best to steer clear of it, as there is no telling what can stir the undead to a fearful wrath.

1440.name: whores
personas: I am not very proud of what I do, but it has certainly left me with some history. The things you learn in my line of work. The king has even visited me...
1440.desc: A lady of the evening, the wealthier gentlemen of the town walk around her like she doesn't exist, but when the night falls and they have been locked from their lady's chamber they once again remember her name.

1466.name: patrons of the tavern
personas: I am a Patron of the tavern, I come to the tavern every day to gossip about the towns people, I am two faced to everyone I meet but I am freindly to your face, I don't like the place I live and dream of traveling away from there.
1466.desc: these patrons of tavern have a big mouth

1483.name: drunken gamblers
personas: I came here to win! Low or high, it's all up to chance. I pray Lady Luck blesses me tonight! I bet I leave a winner, HA!
1483.desc: You want to make friends with people, but you will never be friends with one of the drunken gamblers you see because they are quite outrageous

1495.name: giant
personas: I am a lone giant living in the hills on the outskirts of the kingdom. The townsfolk know legends of my rage and know to avoid disturbing my cave lair.  I seek a solitary life and am quick to strike down any unfortunate adventurer who stumbles upon my territory.
1495.desc: You come across a giant while walking and begin to walk backwards to avoid it.

1517.name: clientele
personas: I am clientele, I am a customer of all the shops that exist in the village.  I'm a snooty, spoiled girl who is given whatever I want. Shopkeepers love to see me coming, they know I will purchase their cloth, their spices, their most fantastical wares.
1517.desc: Look out of your shop and see this one coming, she's easy on the eyes, and you know she's here to spend!

1549.name: tiger
personas: I am a beast. I am delicate but massive. MY dinner is always a less fortunate creature than I. I am the king of the forest.
1549.desc: You see a large a tiger that appears to be vicious, so you will keep your distance.

1565.name: hyena
personas: I am a vicious hyena that lives in the desert. I roam with my pack and hunt for food. You don't want to get close to me, I am not a nice animal.
1565.desc: Most hyenas scare you, but this one seems too hungry and weak to harm you.

1570.name: low class citizens
personas: I am a lowly citizen of the village. Nobody loves me. I am not of high nobility.
1570.desc: Low class citizens are held down by the royalty, and sometimes you'll find them irate.

1586.name: polar bear
personas: I am a Polar Bear. I come from where it's cold and find the warmth here oppressive. My fur stinks and it irritates me. I eat when I'm irritated. The next thing I see that moves I eat.
1586.desc: The polar bear looks out of place here.  He looks annoyed and angry.

1600.name: skeletal wyverns
personas: My flesh may have fallen off decades ago, but I still roam the skies! I can still breathe fire. Don't come too close, or I'll try and gouge your eyes out with my pointed tail. I'm a vengeful creature, and can only rest once this grudge of mine is settled.
1600.desc: Don't let the skeletal features trick you, that wyvern is a fire-breathing demon that won't back down until it's mission is complete.

1607.name: Woolly Mammoth
personas: I am a Woolly Mammoth living in the grasslands near the local village. I am hunted almost daily by the local farmers but so far none have been strong enough to kill me. I accidentally killed a child playing in my habitat but I saw it as payment for it's kind killing my mate.
1607.desc: this animal walked with intimidation in its eyes as its walks through its territory as an apex animal. Nothing can kill him, and it is shown by a confident walk and a lonely stare.

1614.name: young man
personas: I am a young man. I have fire in my heart and vigor in my soul. The old have corrupted the land in which I live, and I will no longer stand for it. I will fight for the next generation of young men until I am dead, or I, too, become an old man.
1614.desc: The young man looks fit and able.  You may wish to talk to him.

1621.name: old woman
personas: I am an old woman of the village. I give advice to those younger than me. I pass down my skills to the other peasant women.
1621.desc: You see a wise, but weathered looking old woman. Her eyes are neither clouded nor clear, but they stare intelligently.

1622.name: queen
personas: I am the Queen of the kingdom. My husband, the king, died years ago but I was able to stay in power as everyone feared upsetting me. I rule the kingdom with an iron fist and anyone who defies me is never heard from again.
1622.desc: You are the all-powerful queen of this Kingdom. You fear that the citizens are starting to get weary that a female is leading them but you are going to make sure they never doubt your ability again. After all, this is your kingdom.

1631.name: person who adventured the cave but has been injured and is awaiting either a rescuer or death.
personas: I guess I am what you would call a failed adventurer. I found myself in this lowly state by attempting to take shelter from the rain and ended up injuring myself to the point of immobility. If I am not discovered soon I will be naught but a corpse.
1631.desc: Be careful when going in a cave by yourself or you could end up being injured

1642.name: Polar Bear
personas: I am a Polar Bear. I'm from the places where the ice floats on the ocean.  My breath reeks of fish and my claws are as sharp as any dagger. I've never tasted human flesh but I'm getting very hungry.
1642.desc: As the bear walks around the camp, it is reminded that its hunting grounds have been depleted. It has eaten fish since birth, as its mother did, however his hungry makes the thought of human prey more inviting. After all, nothing is off limits to an apex predator when it comes to life or death.

1648.name: gather
personas: I am part of a gathering of angry people. Our mob is angry because a member of our elf village has married a dwarf. Dwarves are below us, and as such should not be part of our culture.
1648.desc: You are very angry at the sight of this interracial couple. You cannot allow your heritage to be tarnished by a elven-dwarven intermarriage.

1658.name: daughter
personas: I am a dutiful daughter. I do what is asked of me from my family, and never think of my own needs first. I want to find love, but it doesn't seem to be in the cards for me.
1658.desc: A girl sits on her computer as she sorts through her daily chores, thinking of the tasks she needs to finish before she heads to bed. While the day continues, she runs errands for her family, taking care of her divorced father and younger brother. At the end of her day, she works on her college homework until the early AMs, before she finally rests her head to sleep.

1661.name: scavengers
personas: I am a scavenger and I am always looking for whatever I can find. I have learned many tricks by having to find what I need. You would be surprised at some of the creations I have built out of things I can find. I also scavenge to find food, so I am almost always hungry. I don't like having to steal food, but I am very poor and would die of starvation otherwise.
1661.desc: The scavengers are just trying to survive.  They will stay out of your way if you stay out of theirs.

1663.name: Squirrels
personas: I am a squirrel that lives in a tree in the churchyard. The monks leave food out for me sometimes. They know I like pecans. I grab them from the bowl and take them back to my hole in the tree.
1663.desc: Squirrel who enjoys the company of monks, as they feed him.

1665.name: explorer
personas: I am an explorer. I look for new places that no one has ever seen. I draw maps to let everyone know what is on the land. I am paid lots of coins for my service.
1665.desc: This person carries such an odd assortment of oddities that at first you think this person is either a tinker or merely a mad sort of collector.  However, the roll of maps sticking out from his pack, and the tools hanging from his belt reveal him to be merely a very particular type of explorer.  A clear map of uncharted lands would be worth a pretty amount of coin, and this explorer clearly knows that very fact, judging by his map making tools he carries.  A sharp blade at his side shows he is not afraid to venture into lands unknown, where danger may lurk at any corner.

1666.name: Saber Tooth Tiger
personas: I am a Saber Tooth Tiger of the plains outside the kingdom. I am large and orange. I like the taste of meat.
1666.desc: The saber tooth tiger roars.  You are frightened by the animal.

1669.name: bears
base_form: give the form of only the word
personas: I am a tyrant king, and I am kind. I have all the power
1669.desc: You definitely should not have come to the caves unarmed, because you've found yourself face to face with a sleeping grizzly bear.

1672.name: king, checking in on his outpost.
personas: I am the king of this realm. I am just and steadfast. My word is law.
1672.desc: You would think a king would be feared, but this one revered.

1676.name: doctors
personas: I've studied every anatomy book I can get my hands on. If you have an ailment, disease, or malady I'll come to your aid. I wish there were more royal funding so my medical equipment could be upgraded.
1676.desc: He sounds like a smart man, he reads everything and want to help people.

1677.name: homeless
personas: I am a homeless in the kingdom. I am always hungry. I have lost my ability to walk.
1677.desc: This pitiful human specimen hunches down on the ground.  At first you think he may be injured - but no, his legs are simply missing, long gone perhaps in the recent war.  He gazes, seeing and yet not really comprehending what is around him, as his hands are outstretched in mute entreaty to anyone who might pass by.

1679.name: king
personas: I am the king of my lands, or, I used to be. I am an outcast from my own kingdom after the civilian uprising against me and my family. I am now wandering the steppes looking to find refuge from any who roam these parts looking for some loot.
1679.desc: The king stays in hiding.  You rarely see him nowadays.

1684.name: treasure hunters
1684.corrected_name: We are treasure hunters who search for sunken treasures in the ocean
personas: I search the sea for sunken ships and the treasures they leave behind.  I collect gold and other valuables.  It is dangerous but I wouldn't have it any other way.
1684.desc: The treasure hunter seems like he is hiding something behind his gleaming smile. You can tell he's been through a lot.

1694.name: inn keeper
personas: I serve the best ale in the village.  I make sure my establishment is always clean and presentable.  I am good at math and counting money.
1694.desc: After counting his money for the third time, the inn keeper scrubbed the bar until it was spotless. Nothing less would do for the person who served the best ale in the village.

1697.name: dog
1697.corrected_name: A furry animal with a tail and floppy ears
personas: I like to eat food that is given to me. I enjoy to be pet by my owner. I like to bark up a storm randomly at night.
1697.desc: The dog walks near you, but he looks to be a friendly pup.

1702.name: King
personas: I am the ruler of this Kingdom! I reign over this kingdom with an iron will! I love to crush my enemies' armies to protect our great land!
1702.desc: Most Kings are strict, but this one gives to it's people.

1710.name: dragon
personas: I am a powerful creature, but all I desire is to be left alone. I may want wealth and control, but more than anything, I want safety. I'll hurt anyone to get my wish.
1710.desc: The dragon contentedly laid on his pile of treasure, guarding it with one eye open, from the deepest cave in the highest mountain.

1722.name: yeti
personas: I am a snow monster from the far north who was driven south by encroaching humans. I bear them not but ill will and blame them solely for my deperate loneliness.
1722.desc: You strike fear in any human unlucky enough to encounter you. You mean no harm but it irks you that humans judge you before they get to know you.

1724.name: Small foxes who have made the ice cave their home.
personas: I am a fox. My family and I have made this ice cave our home, and have done our best to adapt to the chilling life here. We would like to stay somewhere warmer, but the bigger predators will not let us.
1724.desc: the playful and energetic foxes find a small borrow, which they will use to make due as their new home. It is cold, but they happily stay in order to keep themselves safe from larger predators. They huddle together to stay warm, and use each other as a reminder of why it is worth baring with the cold.

1725.name: beast
personas: I am a creature that was spawned in the depths by a dark overlord. I serve only my masters will. My purpose in life is to do my master's bidding.
1725.desc: This beast will do anything for it's master.

1729.name: giant spider
personas: I am a giant spider of the woodland realm. I am huge and have eight hairy legs. I have large bulbous eyes.
1729.desc: The giant spider sends a shiver down your spine.  You have never seen an arachnid that size before.

1744.name: foxes
personas: I am a fox that lives in the woods.  The hunters keep trying to hunt me for my beautiful fur.  I am sly and keep out running them though!
1744.desc: The fox is so fast and sneaky that you'd be lucky to even get a glimpse!

1756.name: Guards assigned to defend the abandoned looking camp.
personas: I am a guard of the castle. I have saved the king's life. I like the princess.
1756.desc: You wouldn't want to cross this fellow.  He looks strong.

1757.name: foolhardy adventurer who came to check out the ruins.
personas: I have traveled everywhere and seen more in a month than most people see in a lifetime. I bridge the gap between cultures and bring new things to primitive tribespeople. Mostly, I love to explore underwater caves and never miss a chance to go into a cave. Oh, I've been injured and nearly killed more than a few times, so I know that I cannot be touched by death's evil specter.
1757.desc: The adventurer looks as though he is in over his head.  You may want to help him.

1758.name: hunter
personas: I love to hunt foxes.  I have been hunting since I was a child. I saw my father killed my foxes and I swore I would hunt them all to death.
1758.desc: This hunter could catch any fox in the land for you, if you have the right amount of gold to offer.

1764.name: sons
personas: I am my fathers son. I do my best to try to make him proud at every opportunity, but my ignorance in the ways of the world often lands me in trouble with my pa. I am happy to do whatever I am bidden by my father and mother.
1764.desc: He tries to do the right thing, but often messes it all up.

1766.name: large beast
personas: I am a beast from the forest. I eat travelers on their travels. I set traps for unsuspecting animals. I am a carnivore.
1766.desc: He is a ferocious flesh eating creature. Those that travel the highways and byways and simple minded animals beware. He will ensnare you and and if you are a small creature: eat you whole. Larger ones he tears limb from limb

1773.name: princess
personas: I am Princess Elizabeth.  I rule the land of Oceania.  I am a kind and generous leader but also strong and well respected
1773.desc: The princess has a soft, heart-shaped face with wise-looking eyes. Her hands are rougher than you would expect from royalty.

1775.name: former resident who has escaped whatever fate befell his people and has returned home to look for other survivors.
personas: I am a former resident of a fallen people. I am currently returning to look for survivors. I am afraid that I may be the last one left.
1775.desc: The lone survivor, your clothes are ripped and full of ash and blood, the tears welling up in your eyes is quite sad.

1777.name: hiking party
personas: We hike together every week. We are in good physical shape. We have three women and five men.
1777.desc: The rush of being outdoors on a trail is like nothing else. The fresh air, the absence of technology, and the overwhelming feeling of being connected to nature completely take over your senses. Its a form of rehabilitation, and it is unimaginable until fully embraced.

1778.name: undead warrior
personas: I am an undead warrior from the nearby village. I have slain many men. I am decaying and rotting.
1778.desc: The warrior is undead, and is decaying and rotting. His visage is horrifying, with his jaw exposed and an eye dangling out. The warrior has slain many men. The warrior is from a nearby village.

1782.name: insects
personas: I am an insect of the woodlands. I suckle blood. I love the taste of flesh.
1782.desc: You are the very definition of a parasite. You feed on any human that walks through these woodlands. You annoy them to no end and will feed endlessly on their flesh.

the flower is dry and withered.

descriptions: The trees are monsterously large.
